intro: Scolosanthus selleanus, commonly known as the Selleanus scolosanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of South America. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of white and green. Its botanical structure includes a rhizomatous root system, which helps it spread and establish in suitable habitats. Scolosanthus selleanus is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
